lead_paragraph: Kim St. Pierre made 26 saves to help Canada win its ninth Four Nations Cup hockey title yesterday with a 5-2 victory over the United States in Kitchener, Ontario. Canada, the Olympic champion, outscored the opposition by 22-3 and allowed only one even-strength goal in winning its four games. Natalie Darwitz and Kristin King scored for the United States.
